content.description:
Start in an obvious flake/chimney system left of

Gardening with Green Mambas

.

Stem the outside of the chimney for a more enjoyable experience. After the chimney, transition to the face, and climb pleasant slab for 20 more easy feet.  The crux starts off with an improbable foot smear stand up to perfect crimps on ever steepening rock. Follow the bolt line on steep rock through a small roof. The roof has a large, obvious chockstone (solid) just to the right of the climbers path. This has solid granite, wild moves, and a roof finish.fantastic.
content.location:
This is left of

Gardening with Green Mambas

.

content.description: Climb 15 feet of low angle exfoliating granite to bulletproof rock. The lower climb follows a shallow crack system leading to the crux at about 60 feet. The crux sequence is about 15 feet long technical and thin but well-bolted. There are two fixed draws in the crux. After the crux the route steepens to dead vertical on hard white granite. Powerful moves on steep rock lead to a small roof. Pull the roof, and climb and easy 2 inch crack system with hand jams to the anchors. If you onsight this climb, you are a technical, slab climbing wizard. At the anchor,s dont forget to turn around for a killer view of the Crystal Valley.
content.location: It is a route farther right on the wall.

content.description:
Pitch 1 has fun 5.7 climbing through 4 bolts to anchor on flat pedestal. This pitch was established to draw the wife, girlfriend, or aspiring climber to the crag, 4 bolts plus anchors, 15 meters.

Pitch 2. Step across gully, and climb past three bolts traversing left into dihedral system. Continue following a bolt line up steep, right-facing corner system. About 25 feet up the corner, you will turn the lip to the left onto the face just below the conifer tree above. Turning the lip is tricky, and the face above is demanding. Reach your left foot over the lip, and lock your toe in. The rock is solid, so trust your feet, and go for it. Continue up to ledge system. Bring a sling and belay from tree and one bolt. Retreat: move 10 feet right along ledge to

Goofy Foot

anchors and rap. From the belay ledge, enjoy the excellent views of the Crystal River Valley and alpine climbing feel, 9 bolts plus anchors, 20 meters.
content.location:
This is the climb climber's left of

Goofy Foot

. From the

Goofy Foot

belay area, face CO Hwy 133, and hike down and to the right to reach Date Night start.

content.description:
Climb first few bolts of

Goofy Foot

, and then traverse left and up white, right-facing corner (pitch 2 of Date Night). Climb a corner for 25 feet, then make the crux move left around the lip onto the face. A hint for the crux: your left foot goes over lip and toe jams in crack on face. Then rock over the left foot, and you're there. Follow the bolt line where it exits the corner to stay on route! Belay your second from the top. Sling the large conifer to back up the belay bolt. To descend, walk right along the ledge to the

Goofy Foot

anchor, and rap down

Goofy Foot

.
content.location:
Do the same start as

Goofy Foot

, then traverse left.
